title: Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Room 5600, Rockefeller family office, Series 2
finding_aid_title: A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs, Room 5600, Rockefeller family office, Series 2
finding_aid_filing_title: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) photographs, Room 5600, Rockefeller family office, Series 2

revision_statements.date: finding aid revision date not supplied
revision_statements.description: <date>4 August 2010</date><item>Imported into the Archivists’ Toolkit by Aurexus and Becky Robbins.</item>

subnotes.content: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at <extref href="http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php">http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php</extref>

Permission is required in order to publish or otherwise use photographs and other visual materials of living members of the Rockefeller family. See RAC Head of Reference for details.

Images of Happy Rockefeller while she is officially serving as the Second Lady of the United States are open for scholarly use.

RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of United States copyright law.

Additional images of Nelson A. Rockefeller and or his interests will be found in the following:

Rockefeller Family Photographs. Most of the photos of Nelson A. Rockefeller in his childhood and many photos of Nelson A. Rockefeller as an adult with his parents can be found in 1005 John D. Rockefeller Jr. Family - Children's Albums or Group Portraits. See also John D. Rockefeller Jr. - Business - 17 West 54th Street.

International Basic Economy Corporation (IBEC) Archives.

Nelson A. Rockefeller papers, Art, Series C (FA340). This series documents the management of Nelson A. Rockefeller's art collection and includes photos of a portion of the works of art he owned.

The Nelson A. Rockefeller photographs are arranged in the following series:

Series 1008: Nelson A. Rockefeller family. Series 2: Room 5600, Rockefeller family office. Series 3: Gubernatorial Press Office. Series 4: Gubernatorial Press Office. Series 5: Gubernatorial, Robert A. (Bob) Wands. Series 6: Vice Presidential. Series 7: Unprocessed photographs.

Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

Rockefeller family photographic holdings are arranged into the following series: 

Rockefeller family and Avery family photographs, Series 1001. 
William Avery Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1002. 
John D. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1003. 
William Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1004. 
John D. Rockefeller Jr. family photographs, Series 1005. 
Pocantico Hills photographs, Series 1006. 
John D. Rockefeller 3rd family photographs, Series 1007. 
Nelson A. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1008. 
Laurance S. Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1009. 
David Rockefeller family photographs, Series 1010.
